content.text:
[cron:8b380d56-7314-4ba9-b4c4-ea11d3e5ca6f PR Review Patrol (High Frequency)] High-frequency PR patrol for bills-bot.

Repo: /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot/

Do this each run:
1) List open PRs in BillChirico/bills-bot.
2) Skip bot-authored PRs by default (e.g., coderabbitai, dependabot[bot], renovate[bot]) unless Bill explicitly instructs otherwise.
3) For remaining PRs, count unresolved review threads.
4) If no unresolved threads on eligible PRs: respond exactly `NO_REPLY`.
5) If unresolved threads exist:
   - Spawn ONE sub-agent PER PR (parallel), never batch PRs together.
   - Use agentId `build`, model `anthropic/claude-opus-4-6`, thinking `high`.
   - Include full unresolved thread details (thread id, file path, line, issue summary).
   - Instruct spawned agents to read and follow CODING.md, fix all review comments (including nitpicks unless nonsensical/breaking/redundant), run tests/coverage, resolve threads.
   - Instruct spawned agents NOT to post PR summary comments unless Bill explicitly asks.
   - Have spawned agents report completion summary back to parent agent.
   - After spawning, send Bill a concise Discord DM status update:
     - channel: discord
     - target: user:191633014441115648
     - accountId: pip-build
     - include PR numbers and unresolved thread counts.
6) If any spawned run fails/stalls, note it in DM and respawn once.

Keep updates concise and action-oriented.
Current time: Wednesday, February 11th, 2026 ‚Äî 2:37 PM (America/New_York)

content.thinking:
**Initiating PR Patrol**

I'm now starting a high-frequency PR patrol for `bills-bot`. My initial step is to list open pull requests within the `BillChirico/bills-bot` repository using `gh pr list`. Next, I will filter out any PRs authored by bots, such as `coderabbitai`. The goal is to focus on human-authored PRs.


**Checking for Review Status**

I've moved on to checking for unresolved review threads. I'm using `gh api graphql` to get the relevant data. Sub-agents will be spawned for each PR with unresolved threads, using `anthropic/claude-opus-4-6` and `thinking: high`. I'm going to send a direct message to Bill with the status and make sure it has the context it needs to take over.

arguments.command: cd /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot && gh pr list --state open --json number,title,headRefName,author --jq '.[]'

content.thinking:
**Confirming The Condition**

I've determined that since no PRs are open in `bills-bot`, there aren't any unresolved threads either. This means the required condition, "If no unresolved threads on eligible PRs," is satisfied. I'm now certain I need to respond with `NO_REPLY`. I'll verify this with `git status` to be sure.

                                        en

                                        openclaw/openclaw#13672    Landed on m
                                        ain                                   
                                        via                                   
                                        https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw/c
                                        ommit/ca629296c668511016241099dc4be9b0
                                        373fe8ca.                             
                                        Thanks @BillChirico!                  
                                        stonerl/Thaw#44    Thanks @stonerl &  
                                        @BillChirico, the beta build appears  
                                        to be working.                        
                                        rz1989s/claude-code-statusline#185    
                                        Fixed                                 
                                        in 6f37ad0 on the `nightly` branch.   
                                        **Root cause:** The `${subdir^}`      
                                        syntax (capitalize first letter)      
                                        requires Bash 4.2+. macOS ships with  
                                        Bash 3.2 by default, which doesn't    
                                        support this syntax.  **Fixes         
                                        applied:** - Replaced `${subdir^}` wit
                                        h                                     
                                        portable `tr`-based capitalization    
                                        (works on Bash 3.2+) - Added early Bas
                                        h                                     
                                        guard to catch non-bash shell         
                                        invocations (dash, ash, zsh via `sh`) 
                                        -                                     
                                        Changed `sh -c` to `bash -c` in re-run
                                        instructions to prevent POSIX shell   
                                        issues  To get the fix now, re-install
                                        from the nightly branch: ```bash bash 
                                        -                                     
                                        c "$(curl -sSfL                       
                                        https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rz19
                                        89s/claude-                           
                                        code-statusline/nightly/install.sh)" -
                                        - --                                  
                                        branch=nightly ```  Thanks for        
                                        reporting this @BillChirico!

stonerl/Thaw#73	comment on [Feature Request]: double click to reveal always-hidden	> > This is a great idea, but kind of goes against "Always Hide" @BillChirico  >  > From my understanding, this seems compatible with "_Automatically rehide_", since the option already exists here : "_Show Thaw Icon_" -> "_Click to show hidden or double-click for alwavs-hidden menu bar items_". >  > I might be missing something, but could you clarify what you mean?  I'm just saying that "Always Hide" means it should never be shown. It's just a wording issue.
stonerl/Thaw#77	comment on 	The Thai value appears to have a typo/inconsistency for "icon" ("‡∏≠‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ô...") compared to other Thai strings in this file that use "‡πÑ‡∏≠‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ô". Please correct the spelling for consistency. ```suggestion             "value" : "‡πÑ‡∏≠‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ô‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡∏Å‡∏≥‡∏´‡∏ô‡∏î‡πÄ‡∏≠‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏ä‡πâ‡∏•‡∏±‡∏Å‡∏©‡∏ì‡∏∞‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡∏õ‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏è‡πÅ‡∏ö‡∏ö‡πÑ‡∏î‡∏ô‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏¥‡∏Å" ```
stonerl/Thaw#77	comment on 	This Thai format string has an extra trailing space at the end. Also consider using positional specifiers ("%1$@", "%2$@") like most other localizations for this key to keep formatting consistent. ```suggestion             "value" : "‡πÄ‡∏ß‡∏≠‡∏£‡πå‡∏ä‡∏±‡πà‡∏ô %1$@ (%2$@)" ```

content.thinking:
**Confirming Repository Context**

I've verified my authentication with `gh status`, and confirmed there were no open PRs in `bills-bot`. Then, I realized the prompt specifies `BillChirico/bills-bot`, prompting me to check the context. The crucial point is that `gh pr list` defaults to the current directory, which could have been different.
